headline: Ahead of Black Friday, Deal-Seeking Shoppers Are on a Spree
summary: Big retailers have discovered the American consumer is far from dead. Despite hand-wringing over tariffs and a wobbling economy, shoppers are spending where they see value, evidenced by recent results from Walmart, Best Buy, discount retailer TJX and other chains.

headline: Assessing Best Buy’s Value After Health Tech Expansion and 7% Stock Bounce in 2025
summary: Thinking about whether Best Buy is a bargain right now? You are not alone, as the company continues to spark debates about where its value truly lies. This year has been a rollercoaster for Best Buy shareholders, with the stock bouncing 7.1% higher in the last week, still down 7.6% year-to-date and roughly 5.4% lower than a year ago. Recent headlines have spotlighted the evolving state of retail, with Best Buy in focus for its expansion into health tech partnerships and continued efforts to...

headline: Retailers- Three Reads on Consumer Spending Ahead of the Holidays
summary: Retail stocks were a bright spot yesterday. Shares of Kohl's Corp. (KSS) soared after the retailer increased its forecast for the second straight quarter. Abercrombie & Fitch Co. (ANF) also surged on the back of better results and a boosted forecast, notes Amber Kanwar, host of the In the Money with Amber Kanwar podcast.

raw.headline: Retailers- Three Reads on Consumer Spending Ahead of the Holidays

headline: Review & Preview: Who Needs AI?
summary: It turns out stocks can still rise without the vaunted artificial intelligence trade.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 664 points, or 1.4%, and the S&P 500 gained 0.9% despite down days from AI stalwarts Advanced Micro Devices (-4.2%), Nvidia (-2.6%), and Oracle (-1.6%).  Home builders Lennar and D.R. Horton were up 6.6% and 5.8%, respectively.

Home builders Lennar and D.R. Horton were up 6.6% and 5.8%, respectively.
